pli-tv-bi-vb-pc35:2.1: The nuns’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc35:3.1: The chapter on offenses entailing confession
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc35:5.1: 35. The training rule on throwing out
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc35:6.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc35:6.2: At that time Bhaddā Kāpilānī had entered the rainy-season residence at Sāketa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc35:6.3: But because she was troubled by some business, she sent a message to the nun Thullanandā:
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc35:6.4: “If you would give me a dwelling place, I would come to Sāvatthī.”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc35:6.6: “Please come, I will give you one.”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc35:6.7: Then Bhaddā Kāpilānī traveled from Sāketa to Sāvatthī,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc35:6.8: and Thullanandā gave her a dwelling place.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc35:6.9: At that time Thullanandā was a learned reciter, and she was confident and skilled at giving teachings.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc35:6.10: Bhaddā Kāpilānī, too, was a learned reciter who was confident and skilled at giving teachings, and she was respected for her excellence.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc35:6.12: Because of this, people visited Bhaddā Kāpilānī first and then Thullanandā.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc35:6.14: “These ones always ask for things and tell people what to do, and yet they are supposedly contented and have few desires, supposedly secluded and not socializing.” And in anger she threw Bhaddā Kāpilānī out from that dwelling place.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc35:7.1: The nuns of few desires complained and criticized her,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc35:7.3: “How could Venerable Thullanandā give a dwelling place to Venerable Bhaddā Kāpilānī and then throw her out in anger?” …
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc35:7.4: “Is it true, monks, that the nun Thullanandā did this?”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc35:7.7: How can the nun Thullanandā give a dwelling place to Bhaddā Kāpilānī and then throw her out in anger?
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc35:7.8: This will not give rise to confidence in those without it …
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc35:7.9: And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule thus:
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc35:8.1: ‘If a nun gives a dwelling place to another nun, and then, in anger, throws her out or gets her thrown out, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc35:9.4: … The nun who has been given the full ordination by both complete Orders through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc35:10.4: one that has a door is what is meant.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc35:11.2: if she takes hold of her in a room and throws her out to the porch, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc35:11.3: If she takes hold of her on the porch and throws her outside, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc35:11.4: Even if she makes her go through many doors with a single effort, she commits one offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc35:12.2: if she asks another, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc35:12.3: If she only asks once, then even if the other makes her go through many doors, she commits one offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc35:13.1: If she is fully ordained, and she perceives her as fully ordained, and she gives her a dwelling place, and she then throws her out in anger or gets her thrown out, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc35:13.2: If she is fully ordained, but she is unsure if she is, and she gives her a dwelling place, and she then throws her out in anger or gets her thrown out, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc35:13.3: If she is fully ordained, but she does not perceive her as such, and she gives her a dwelling place, and she then throws her out in anger or gets her thrown out, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc35:14.1: If she throws out one of her requisites, or she gets it thrown out, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc35:14.2: If she throws her out or gets her thrown out from a dwelling place without a door, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc35:14.3: If she throws out one of her requisites from a dwelling place without a door, or she gets it thrown out, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc35:14.4: If she throws out one who is not fully ordained, or gets her thrown out, from a dwelling place with or without a door, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc35:14.5: If she throws out one of her requisites from that place, or gets it thrown out, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc35:14.6: If she is not fully ordained, but she perceives her as fully ordained, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc35:14.7: If she is not fully ordained, but she is unsure of it, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc35:14.8: If she is not fully ordained, and she does not perceive her as fully ordained, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc35:15.2: if she is the first offender.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc35:16.1: The fifth training rule is finished.
